sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: President of the European Council Charles Michel has come under fire as he announced he was leaving his post early to run for European elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Farmers have blocked roads all over the country, kicking off a week of protests against the government plan to eliminate tax benefits for farmers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Snow and icy conditions continue to cause havoc across Europe as temperatures fall to minus 40 in some countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: President of the European Council Charles Michel's announcement that he is ending his mandate earlier than expected to run for European elections has raised some eyebrows in Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A prominent Dutch MEP, Sophie Indveld, from the same centrist liberal political family as Michel, wrote on social media that Michel was acting like a captain leaving his ship in the middle of a storm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: When asked by Euronews, expert Alberto Alemano said Michel's decision was selfish.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So in a way, this is really terra incognita, is a new area, a new space for the European leaders, which Michel is actually doing just to pursue his own self-interest. It's certainly not in the interest of the European Union to have him end his political mandate before his natural term, which would have been November 2024. According to EU law, if a replacement for the EU Council presidency is not found in time, the position will go to whoever is next in rotation. In theory, this could mean the key position could land in the hands of Hungary's Eurosceptic Prime Minister Viktor Orban, who is due to hold the EU's rotating presidency from July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But it appears much more likely that by then European leaders will find a replacement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Most likely, in my interpretation, will be a temporary interim replacement, somebody who is going to cover the natural ending of this mandate of Mr. Michel from, let's say, June to November. And then as a part of the package of the new European top jobs, a new name will be identified. Sources close to Charles Michel told journalists that EU leaders could eventually find his successor in June right after the elections or they could change the rules to find a successor for the interim period.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: German farmers blocked the main motorway access roads in some parts of the country on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's the start of a week of protests against the government plan to eliminate tax benefits for farmers. In Berlin, hundreds of tractors blocked the main access to the Brandenburg Gate. Protests planned for the next seven days include rallies that will disrupt traffic in several regions. Farmers are promising to block the roads for the next eight days despite the German government revising the 2024 budget that sparked these protests Die Bundesrepublik hat eine Steuererhöhung einseitig gegen die einzige Branche, die weitgehend klimaneutral arbeitet, nämlich die Landwirtschaft.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Wir nutzen ja die Sonnenenergie hauptsächlich.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Verkauft als Abbau von klimaschädlichen Subventionen. Also das ist so abgrundverlogen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The ruling coalition, led by Chancellor Olaf Scholz, infuriated farmers last month with plans to abolish the car tax exemption for agricultural vehicles and tax breaks on diesel fuel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The snow and extreme cold in Europe continue to complicate life for thousands of citizens throughout the continent, north and south.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Sweden recorded minus 43.6 degrees Celsius, its lowest temperature since 1999, while in Denmark temperatures have dropped to minus 20 degrees, causing traffic disruption.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This morning Danish car assistance companies received inquiries from more than 2,000 motorists who needed help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There have been traffic accidents in several places.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Snow and sub-zero temperatures on Monday also caused another day of disruption across Moldova, prompting authorities in the capital to close schools and suspend public transport.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Police have also warned drivers to take caution after assisting vehicles that veered off the roads amid the icy conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Convicted mass murderer Anders Breivik appeared in court on Monday in a second attempt to sue the Norwegian state for allegedly breaching his human rights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Breivik, a right-wing extremist who killed 77 people in a deadly rampage, appeared before a judge in Oslo, claiming his solitary confinement since being imprisoned in 2012 amongst the inhumane treatment under the European Convention of Human Rights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A similar claim during a case in 2016 was accepted, but later overturned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: On the 22nd of July 2011, Breivik killed eight people in a bomb attack in Oslo before heading to a youth camp on Utoya Island, where, dressed as a police officer, he stalked and gunned down 69 more, mostly teenagers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He has shown no remorse for his attacks, which he portrayed as a crusade against multiculturalism in Norway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Russia launched a wave of missile and drone attacks on Monday across several regions of Ukraine, leaving four dead and 38 injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Monday's attacks targeted several civilian areas including residential buildings and a shopping mall across Ukraine's Saporizhia, Kamenetsky, Dnipropetrovsk and Kharkiv oblast. According to Kharkiv's officials Russia's attack damaged an enterprise residential buildings and an educational institution. institution Russia fired more than 50 missiles of various types and eight Iranian made Shahed drones the Ukrainian Air Force intercepted all drone attacks and 18 of the cruise missiles, according to Ukraine's Ministry of Defense. Russia's defense ministry says the armed forces launched strikes by high-precision, long-range, sea and air-based weapons at Ukraine's military industrial complex facilities. In the Russia-occupied Luhansk region, a Russian warplane accidentally released a bomb on the town of Rubizny.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian authorities claim the bomb fell over a residential quarter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In a foreign policy speech on Monday, Pope Francis called for a universal ban on surrogacy, which he called a despicable practice and a serious violation of the dignity of women and children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In his speech, the Pope went on to say a child is a gift that should not be transformed into an object of trafficking and should not be, in his words, the basis of commercial exploitation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Pope gave the speech on foreign policy to the ambassadors accredited to the Holy Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has vowed that the war in Gaza will continue until Israel reaches all its objectives,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: including the elimination of Hamas and the return of all Israeli hostages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: of Hamas and the return of all Israeli hostages. During an Israeli war cabinet meeting, he spoke about Lebanon's Hezbollah, warning them to learn what Hamas has already learned in the previous months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the chief spokesman of the Israeli army said a sensitive air traffic control base in northern Israel had been hit by a Hezbollah a day earlier.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He didn't give details on the extent of the damage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In the West Bank, a Palestinian toddler was killed by mistake after Israeli police opened fire at a pair of suspected attackers at a checkpoint in the occupied territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The girl was reported to be three or four years old.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: A video released by the Israeli army showed what they say are their soldiers operating in the Daraj Tafa area in the northern Gaza Strip. It follows the end of a major combat in the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Almost 23,000 Palestinians have been killed in the war, which has now entered its fourth month. According to the health ministry in Gaza, these have mostly been women and minors. The Hamas-ruled body does not differentiate between civilian and combatant deaths.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Three. We have ignition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: NASA launched its first rocket to the moon in over 50 years on Monday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The Peregrine lander, carried on United Launch Alliance's Vulcan rocket, is also the first ever launch by a private company.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Peregrine has been contracted by NASA to carry five scientific instruments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: These will study the moon's surface environment ahead of human missions later this decade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The buzziest city in the world just got a lot noisier. The tech community is in Las Vegas for

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: CES, the Consumer Electronics Show. Thousands of tech companies will be spread out across the equivalent of 43 football fields and the big topic everywhere this year is artificial intelligence used by this company which monitors your health via a selfie. Our AI is a big part of this so we're actually using what we call effective AI. Effective AI what we're doing is we're taking physiological and psychological biomarkers and we're using that to basically understand your health condition in real time. AI is also being used in space.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The AI is very important because since we are working first of all with the astronauts, the AI is going to collect the data. Our main and huge step is that we are preparing an AI as a psychologist for astronauts for Mars.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Back on Earth, governments are trying to wrangle how to regulate AI to protect our data.
